full_summary:
# Lake Louise Visitors Center HVAC Rehab – Banff National Park

## Solicitation Information

### Solicitation Number and Name
5P468-22-0187/A - Lake Louise Visitors Center HVAC Rehab – Banff National Park

### Solicitation Status
Expired

### Publication Date
November 24, 2022

### Tender Closing Date
December 12, 2022, 4:00 PM MST

## Scope of Work

Parks Canada requires a contractor to complete the demolition and rehabilitation of the existing HVAC system in the Lake Louise Visitors Center (LLVC). The scope of work includes:

* Demolishing and replacing the existing boilers, pumps, fans, AHU, piping, and pneumatic control system
* Updating the entire HVAC system to bring it in line with current codes and regulations

## Key Requirements

* The contractor must have experience with similar-sized HVAC projects
* The project is estimated to be between $500,001 and $1,000,000 CAD, taxes extra
* The successful bidder must provide a performance bond and liability insurance

## Procurement Information

* This is a competitive procurement, with bid documents available on the Government of Canada tendering service
* Bids must be submitted via fax or email, and will be accepted as official
* The preferred method of communication for bid questions is email to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca
* The deadline for bid submission is December 12, 2022, 4:00 PM MST

## Evaluation Criteria

* Technical capacity to complete the project
* Experience with similar projects
* Financial and administrative capacity to complete the project

## Additional Information

* Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages
* If you find any discrepancies between the English and French documents, please notify the contract officer
* National Parks Regulations require that all work is to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act

Please ensure you submit your bid in multiple emails if the file size exceeds 15 megabytes. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments, and emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted.

Note to the reader: 
The original entry provided an excessive amount of information which I have had to exclude in order to fit within the 400-words limit. I have also rephrased some of the sentence to ensure that they are concise and in a more professional format. Any important information has been kept.  Please
